title: OrderSum: Semantic Sentence Ordering for Extractive Summarization
author: Taewan Kwon (Dongguk University), Sangyong Lee (Korea University), ..., Taewan Kwon (Dongguk University)
relevance_why: The methodology of integrating sentence order into the summarization process could enhance audio and speech document summarization projects by improving the coherence and relevance of generated summaries.
background: Extractive summarization aims to select sentences from a document to create a coherent summary, and this paper introduces a model that also considers the order of these sentences.
contribution: OrderSum introduces a new representation method and objective function to semantically order sentences in extractive summaries, achieving state-of-the-art performance in both sentence inclusion and order.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous extractive summarization models often focused only on selecting the best sentences, neglecting the importance of their order, which can degrade summary readability.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work significantly improves by incorporating a multi-task learning approach that includes both sentence relevance and order in its training process.

key_innovation: The model generates multiple candidate summaries with varied sentence orders and uses a cosine similarity metric in the semantic space to evaluate and select the best summary.
real_world_impact: This research could enhance web content summarization tools, making them more effective for information extraction in news articles and other document types, thus improving user experience in information retrieval.
limitations: The paper does not discuss the potential computational complexity associated with generating and evaluating multiple candidate summaries.

new_terms.cosine similarity: **Cosine similarity** is a metric used to measure how similar two vectors are, calculated as the cosine of the angle between them, often used in high-dimensional spaces to find document similarity.
new_terms.extractive summarization: **Extractive summarization** refers to the process of selecting a subset of sentences from a text document to create a summary, using techniques that prioritize sentences based on relevance.

open_sourcing: Our code and the model parameters are available at https://github.com/Espresso-AI/OrderSum
